bibl.title: Faces of the Crowd. Popular Society and Politics of Roman Alexandria, 30 BC - AD 215.
bibl.note: Diss. Univ. of Michigan. Summary in DA 49 (1988-1989) pp. 1244-1245-A. - Alexandria was a stable city, only occasionally disrupted by outbreaks of violence.
bibl.seg: Barry William Dunne, Faces of the Crowd. Popular Society and Politics of Roman Alexandria, 30 BC - AD 215.
